title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that several spells of showers will occur in Eastern and Uva provinces and in Polonnaruwa, Nuwara-Eliya and Matale districts.

title: US death toll from extreme weather over the weekend rises to 36
byline: Portions of Pennsylvania, New York and Mid-Atlantic and Southeast states were still under a National Weather Service watch for damaging wind and tornadoes, as the death toll from weekend storms rose to 36 people across six states.

title: 2024 O/L exam to commence at over 3,600 centres
byline: The 2024 (2025) G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) examination begins today (17) at 3,663 centres across the island, with 474,147 candidates expected to sit for the exam.

title: Shooting incident reported in Midigama
byline: A shooting incident has been reported at a house in the Pathegama area of Midigama early this morning (17).

title: Train breaks down causing delays on  coastal line
byline: The Department of Railways announced that a train has encountered a technical fault near the Panadura railway station this morning (17), causing delays in the coastal line train operations.

title: Trump moves to close down Voice of America
byline: US President Donald Trump has signed an order to strip back federally funded news organisation Voice of America, accusing it of being “anti-Trump” and “radical”.

title: 2025 LG Polls: Accepting of nominations begins
byline: The accepting of nominations for the upcoming Local Government (LG) Elections begins today (Jan 17).

title: Smart board project for 1,000 schools failed to meet objectives – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the project to distribute smart boards for 1,000 schools with the goal of enhancing education has completely failed to meet its objectives and the investment of LKR 1.7 billion has been underutilized.

title: Eight suspects arrested over Grandpass double murder
byline: Grandpass Police have launched an investigation into the attack on two individuals near the railway line in the Jabos Lane area of the Grandpass Police Division, which occurred in the early hours of March 15.

title: Ex-IGP Deshabandu’s lawyers file motion ahead of appeal decision
byline: The legal counsels of former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon have submitted a motion to the Court of Appeal in relation to the petition filed by him.

title: Trump says he will talk to Putin on Tuesday as he pushes for end to Ukraine war
byline: President Donald Trump said he would speak to Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday as he pushes to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Court of Appeal dismisses Ex-IGP Deshabandu’s petition
byline: The Court of Appeal has dismissed the writ petition filed by former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, seeking an interim injunction to prevent the execution of the arrest order issued by the Matara Magistrate’s Court against him in connection with the shooting incident that took place in Weligama, Matara, in 2023.

title: 21 injured as passenger bus crashes into house in Arachchikattuwa
byline: A passenger bus attached to Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) traveling from Nikaweratiya to Colombo has met with an accident in the Baththuluoya area of the Arachchikattuwa police division this morning (17).

title: Court issues notice against unemployed graduates’ ‘Satyagraha’ campaign
byline: A notice has been issued by the court against a ‘Satyagraha’ campaign and protest organized by the Unemployed Graduates’ Association from today (17) until March 21.

title: Health professionals’ strike confirmed as discussions fail
byline: The Academy of Health Professionals has decided to launch a 24-hour strike starting from 07.00 a.m. tomorrow (17), as previously planned.

title: A’pura hospital sexual assault case suspect further remanded
byline: The suspect arrested in connection with the Anuradhapura hospital sexual assault case has been ordered to be remanded further until March 24, 2025.

title: Wele Suda’s brother arrested for attacking policeman
byline: Police have arrested suspected drug trafficker Sunimal Kumara, alias "Thaju", for allegedly assaulting a police constable with a sharp weapon during a drug raid.

title: OpenAI and Musk agree to fast tracked trial over for-profit shift
byline: OpenAI and Elon Musk have agreed to fast-track a trial over OpenAI’s for-profit shift, the latest turn in a grudge match between the world’s richest person and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman playing out publicly in court.

title: Brands ditch South Korean actor Kim Soo-hyun over dating scandal
byline: Brands including Prada have cut ties with South Korean actor Kim Soo-hyun amid controversy over his relationship with actress Kim Sae-ron who was found dead in February.

title: Ex-Minister Mervyn Silva further remanded
byline: The Mahara Magistrate’s Court has ordered former Minister Mervyn Silva to be remanded further until March 24.

title: Eight suspects remanded over Grandpass double murder
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of eight suspects arrested in connection with the murder of two brothers in the Grandpass police division until March 27.

title: India’s Modi says Trump has ‘clear roadmap’ in second term
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said U.S. President Donald Trump was ‘far more prepared’ for his second term, furnished with a clear roadmap, speaking in a podcast interview weeks ahead of reciprocal tariffs planned by Washington.

title: Sri Lanka’s first supermodel Akushla Sellayah passes away
byline: Sri Lanka’s first supermodel, fashion icon Akushla Sellayah, has passed away.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an ‘Amber’ advisory for severe lightning for several provinces and districts.

title: President instructs to improve quality of infrastructure and services for foreign tourists
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake emphasized the necessity of providing high-quality infrastructure and services for tourists visiting Sri Lanka, as the country has gained significant international recognition as an attractive tourist destination.

title: Boossa Prison Jailor remanded over ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder
byline: A Jailor at the Boossa Prison, who had brought underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararathne also known as “Ganemulla Sanjeewa” to court on the day he was killed inside the Hulftsdorp court premises, has been arrested by the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD).

title: ‘Unicorn’ tusker shot dead in Minneriya, Minister reveals
byline: A well-known tusker named ‘Unicorn’, located in the Minneriya National Park, has died after being shotby certain individuals, Minister of Environment Dr. Dammika Patabendi revealed in Parliament today.

title: FitsAir launches direct flights to Kuala Lumpur
byline: FitsAir, Sri Lanka’s first privately-owned international airline announced that it will expand its regional connectivity with the introduction of direct flights to Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

title: UK says a ‘significant number’ of nations ready to provide troops for Ukraine peace
byline: A “significant number” of countries are willing to provide peacekeeping troops in Ukraine in the event of a peace deal with Russia, a spokesperson for British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Monday.

title: Two injured in shooting at Grandpass
byline: At least two persons have been injured following a shooting incident at Nagalagam Street in Grandpass, Colombo.
